DataElement.preferredDefinition: the clinical assessment to evaluate response of leukemia to treatment following a standard response criteria per protocol using serial evaluations of patient disease from baseline throughout follow-up.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to leukemia disease response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) hematologic disorder, involving hematopoietic stem cells and characterized by the presence of primitive or atypical myeloid or lymphoid cells in the bone marrow and the blood.  Leukemias are classified as acute or chronic based on the degree of cellular differentiation and the predominant cell type present.  Leukemia is usually associated with anemia, fever, hemorrhagic episodes and splenomegaly.  Common leukemias include acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic or precursor lymphoblastic leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia.  Treatment is vital to patient survival; untreated, the natural course of acute leukemias is normally measured in weeks or months, while that of chronic leukemias is more often measured in months or years. -- 2004:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) hematologic disorder, involving hematopoietic stem cells and characterized by the presence of primitive or atypical myeloid or lymphoid cells in the bone marrow and the blood. Leukemias are classified as acute or chronic based on the degree of cellular differentiation and the predominant cell type present. Leukemia is usually associated with anemia, fever, hemorrhagic episodes, and splenomegaly. Common leukemias include acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic or precursor lymphoblastic leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Treatment is vital to patient survival; untreated, the natural course of acute leukemias is normally measured in weeks or months, while that of chronic leukemias is more often measured in months or years.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.changeDescription: Denise Warzel updated Definition by seraching NCI Thesaurus in Admin tool.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: COMPLETE RESPONSE; DISAPPERANCE OF ALL TARGET LESIONS

ValueMeaning.preferredName: COMPLETE RESPONSE; DISAPPERANCE OF ALL TARGET LESIONS
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: COMPLETE RESPONSE; DISAPPERANCE OF ALL TARGET LESIONS
Persistence of one or more non-target lesions.

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesions.

PermissibleValues.value: Insufficient evaluation to determine response status

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: PROGRESSION; AT LEAST A 20% INCREASE IN THE SUM OF LD OF TARGET LESIONS TAKING AS REFERENCES THE SMALLEST SUM LD RECORDED SINCE THE TREATMENT STARTED OR THE APPEARANCE OF ONE OR MORE NEW LESIONS

ValueMeaning.preferredName: PROGRESSION; AT LEAST A 20% INCREASE IN THE SUM OF LD OF TARGET LESIONS TAKING AS REFERENCES THE SMALLEST SUM LD RECORDED SINCE THE TREATMENT STARTED OR THE APPEARANCE OF ONE OR MORE NEW LESIONS
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: PROGRESSION; AT LEAST A 20% INCREASE IN THE SUM OF LD OF TARGET LESIONS TAKING AS REFERENCES THE SMALLEST SUM LD RECORDED SINCE THE TREATMENT STARTED OR THE APPEARANCE OF ONE OR MORE NEW LESIONS
Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: PARTIAL RESPONSE; AT LEAST A 30% DECREASE IN THE SUM OF LD OF TARGET LESIONS TAKING AS REFERENCE THE BASELINE SUM LD

ValueMeaning.preferredName: PARTIAL RESPONSE; AT LEAST A 30% DECREASE IN THE SUM OF LD OF TARGET LESIONS TAKING AS REFERENCE THE BASELINE SUM LD
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: PARTIAL RESPONSE; AT LEAST A 30% DECREASE IN THE SUM OF LD OF TARGET LESIONS TAKING AS REFERENCE THE BASELINE SUM LD
Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: STABLE DISEASE; NEITHER SUFFICIENT SHRINKAGE TO QUALIFY FOR PR NOR SUFFICIENT INCREASE TO QUALIFY FOR PD TAKING AS REFERENCES THE SMALLEST SUM LD SINCE THE TREATMENT STARTED

ValueMeaning.preferredName: STABLE DISEASE; NEITHER SUFFICIENT SHRINKAGE TO QUALIFY FOR PR NOR SUFFICIENT INCREASE TO QUALIFY FOR PD TAKING AS REFERENCES THE SMALLEST SUM LD SINCE THE TREATMENT STARTED
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: STABLE DISEASE; NEITHER SUFFICIENT SHRINKAGE TO QUALIFY FOR PR NOR SUFFICIENT INCREASE TO QUALIFY FOR PD TAKING AS REFERENCES THE SMALLEST SUM LD SINCE THE TREATMENT STARTED
Remission with remaining lymphoid nodules reflecting residual disease.

Concepts.definition: Remission with remaining lymphoid nodules reflecting residual disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment.

Concepts.definition: A disease that resists treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

PermissibleValues.value: Morphologic Complete Remission with Partial Blood Count Recovery (CRh)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Morphologic Complete Response With Partial Blood Count Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Morphologic Complete Response With Partial Blood Count Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: Being or affecting only a part of something.: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.: A getting back or regaining.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Being or affecting only a part of something.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Determining the number or amount of something.
A getting back or regaining.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

PermissibleValues.value: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery (CRi)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

Concepts.longName: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Partial Remission Other Than Persistent Lymphocytosis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Partial Remission Other Than Persistent Lymphocytosis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.: Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered.: Retained; never-ceasing.: A laboratory test result indicating an abnormal increase in the number of lymphocytes in the peripheral blood, effusions, or bone marrow.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.
Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered.
Retained; never-ceasing.
A finding indicating the presence of a non-neoplastic or neoplastic proliferation of lymphocytes in the peripheral blood, effusions, or bone marrow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.: Not responding to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.
Not responding to treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
